sentence: Here's your Investing Action Plan for Tuesday: what you need to know as an investor for the coming day.

[ibd-display-video id=2634200 width=50 float=left autostart=true] Home Depot ( HD ), TJX ( TJX ), YY ( YY ) and Kulicke & Soffa ( KLIC ) lead the earnings charge tomorrow, as another week heavy with Chinese internet and U.S. retail companies picks up momentum.
Two of those stocks, Home Depot and Kulicke & Soffa, are flashing buying signals.
The home-improvement giant releases earnings before the open.
Estimates : EPS to increase 13% to $1.81, with revenue up 5.7% to $24.47 billion, according to Zacks Investment Research.
Stock : Shares were up 1% at 165.72 on the stock market today , above a 160.96 entry from an irregular base.
Watch for any commentary on how much hurricane recovery efforts are boosting demand, adding to already strong business from the housing sector.

Home Depot has rallied more than 20% this year but sold off recently amid concern that Republican proposals to scale back or eliminate the deduction for state and local taxes, including property taxes, and high-value mortgages would weaken the housing market.
The China-based social media company reports after the market close.
Estimates : EPS up 37.5% to $1.54 as revenue grows 35% to $423 million.
Stock : Shares were up 1.9% at 90.60, climbing further beyond buy range after breaking out from an 83.10 entry in late September.
Fellow Chinese stocks have been performing well in their quarterly reports.
On Monday, e-commerce giant JD.com ( JD ) beat estimates , and the so-called Craigslist of China, 58.com (WUBA), also topped views .
IBD'S TAKE:Buying or holding a stock can be risky heading into an earnings report.
Here's anearnings options strategythat can help you cash in on post-earnings stock gains, while minimizing the risk from a weak quarter.
The chip-equipment company reports fiscal Q4 numbers before the open.
Estimates : EPS to soar 140% to 36 cents as revenue climbs 41% to $206 million.
Stock : Shares were up 0.3% at 23.69, still in buying territory after clearing a 23.10 entry last week.
Volume is relatively light, averaging just under 400,000 shares.
Fellow chip-gear maker Applied Materials (AMAT) is scheduled to report fiscal Q4 results after the market close on Thursday.
Analysts expect the Santa Clara, Calif.-based company to earn 90 cents a share, up 36%, on sales of $3.93 billion, up 19%.
The off-price retail chain reports before the market opens.
Estimates : EPS is seen rising 10% to $1 as revenue grows 7% to $8.89 billion.
Stock : Shares were up 0.7% at 70.72, after rising as much as 2.6% intraday.
The retail sector got some good news last week, after Macy's (M) and J.C. Penney (JCP) beat earnings estimates .
But another big test comes later this week when Target (TGT) reports Wednesday and Wal-Mart (WMT) reports Thursday.
TJX's off-price peer Ross Stores (ROST) also reports Thursday.
